alert.note: Alert for Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 26 at 8:46AM CDT until May 26 at 9:15AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM CDT THIS MORNING FOR LUBBOCK COUNTY... At 846 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges showed the line of thunderstorms was moving through southeast Lubbock and was starting to move out of the warning area. Numerous streets in Lubbock showed mostly minor flooding. Between 0.7 and 1.2 inches of rain have fallen. Total amounts between 1 and 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lubbock, Slaton, Wolfforth, Idalou, Ransom Canyon, Downtown Lubbock, Texas Tech University, Lubbock International Airport, Woodrow, Lubbock South Plains Mall, Slide, Reese Center, Buffalo Springs and Lubbock Science Spectrum. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Avoid flooded intersections and roadways. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
